intro: Centaurium majus, commonly known as the greater centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and north Africa. It is a member of the Gentianaceae family and typically grows in grassy areas, meadows, and along roadsides. The plant features bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, and its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Centaurium majus has a compact growth habit, reaching heights of about 15 to 30 centimeters. Its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological importance in its native habitats.
